title: texture: Flip textures with flip_x/flip_y in DrawTextureParams
body: A little quality of life improvement here, no trickery with negative dest width/height anymore :)

title: Add draw_sphere_ex and draw_sphere_wires.
body:
Wow,

This PR adds the functionally to `draw_spheres_wires`. Also was added `draw_sphere_ex` so you can specify the number of slices and rings when drawing the sphere.

This was made because drawing spheres can be really expensive, having this alternative way can help the user choose how good the spheres are drawn.

## Examples:
Normal `draw_sphere`:
![normal_sphere](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35241085/106935152-c270e300-66f9-11eb-97d7-3728e0d5782d.gif)

Normal `draw_sphere_wires`:
![default_wires](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35241085/106935246-dc122a80-66f9-11eb-9d6e-bdcc036d83ac.gif)

`draw_sphere_ex` with rings = 6, slices = 8, draw_mode = DrawMode::Lines:
![wires](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35241085/106935324-fa782600-66f9-11eb-880d-0be580745cc0.gif)

title: Update image to 0.23.12
body:
Advisory about previous versions: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0073.html

Note that cargo audit doesn't seem to warn about it but deps.rs does which makes projects depending on macroquad look insecure.

The png_codec feature was renamed here: https://github.com/image-rs/image/commit/e706bfbb29bc4bb5c54ac644f685bcfb87d8bb07

title: Add Debug and Clone derives to DrawTextureParams
body:
`Clone` would be nice when e.g. calling `draw_texture_ex` a lot, each with a bit more rotation.

Additionally i noticed there are lots of structs missing basic derives like Debug and Clone - should i add them everywhere where it makes sense or is there a reason for it (e.g. compile times)? I think it's commonly accepted in rust that public structs should have at least `Debug` where possible and usually `Clone` is very useful too.

title: update mouse pos even in mouse button events to fix touch pos
body: fixes #136

title: Improve docs in the time module.
coroutines: Make tweens safe
body:
Tweens got a massive refactor and now do not require raw pointers magic to work. Wich makes them safe to use and now if the tweening object got deleted during the tween - the tween would be stopped.
Stopped without a segfault!

Another change - coroutine's future is now Send.
With Send compiler will be a bit grumpier and will save us from Unwrap None panics on runtime.

title: Check snake movement direction
body: fix a bug in snake example, where you can kill yourself trying to move the snake in the opposite direction.

title: physics_platformer: Fix a bug with a collider bigger than a grid
Some README consistency and grammar fixes
Use alpha docs.rs link in readme
Add docs badge and additional link to docs
body: Having a few links to the docs is always nice.

title: Move too experimental things to special module
body: experimental::* is going to have things that not going to make it into 0.3 with a stable api

title: Add license files to the repo

body:
This allows to pause and investigate the frame with a spike.


![profiler](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/910977/103487911-56375280-4dce-11eb-92db-3efeab13dca3.gif)

title: telemetry: New module exposing macroquad performance data
Fix README typos
body: Just typo fixes & adding caching of cargo dependencies to the build workflow

title: added clamp to src/math.rs, polished examples/tree.rs
body:
Added `clamp` function in `src/math.rs`
made `example/tree.rs` look better by fixing screen ratio and adding lerped zooming with mouse wheel. 
Now it uses added `clamp`, so clamp is kinda tested.


note, that according to Rust standard libs, functions like clamp are actually made methods, actually there is f32::clamp, but it's unstable now. For better design mb we should have a trait or smth for feature like this?

title: text: Change text measures logic
body:
I am not quite sure about merging this.
However, after this PR text rendering API will be a little more consistent.

Before this change Y in draw_text was a slightly incorrect top line of the future text. 
After this change Y in draw_text is a baseline of the text.

Pros: 
- Two consecutive calls `draw_text(0.0, 100.0, "A")` and `draw_text(10.0, 100.0, "j")` will draw both characters on the same line. 
- The bug with incorrect text positioning is fixed
- It is easier to figure out a background rectangle for a text

Cons: 
- All the current code using draw_text will be slightly broken 

![2020-12-23-194933_799x443_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/910977/103050095-08625500-4559-11eb-83fd-37387dd1a5e3.png)

title: particles: Fix index buffer too small error
Re-export exec::FileError

math: Re-export glam types
body:
Now its going to be 
```
use macroquad::math::Vec2;
```

instead of 
```
use macroquad::math::glam::Vec2
```

And nothing is going to change for `prelude` users.

body:
0.9 -> 0.10

`.x()` is still allowed, but will give a warning
but `.x` is now available! :tada:

What do you think, @not-fl3?

title: macroquad_macro: Support use case with renamed crate
body:
After this change this is allowed: 

```
#[mq::main("BasicShapes")]
#[macroquad(crate_rename = "mq")]
async fn main() {
}
```

This is the only way to use macroquad with Cargo.toml like this: 
```
[dependencies]
mq = {path = "../macroquad", package="macroquad"}
```

And also this change fix old standing bug with `#[cfg]` attributes on main, so this would also works:
```
#[macroquad::main("BasicShapes")]
#[cfg(target_os = "linux")]
async fn main() {
}
```

title: quad-gl: color_u8! macro
body:
This allows building colors from 4 bytes in compile time.

```
    assert_eq!(Color::new(1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0), color_u8!(255, 0, 0, 255));
```

title: quad-gl: Switch Color from u8 to f32
body:
Now Color is 
```
pub struct Color {
  pub r: f32,
  pub g: f32,
  pub b: f32,
  pub a: f32
}
```

instead of 
```
pub struct Color(pub [u8; 4]);
```

Now we can destruct Color, access individual fields, keep >1.0 values inside Color struct etc.
While inside quad-gl still use [u8; 4], so this change should not affect perfomance at all. 

However it is a breaking change - some function signatures changed and `.r()` getter are now gone.
